stories.text: There is an article I cam across on HN, one or two years ago where at the author went into detail on numerous api security authentication and authorization implementation protocols, his experience with each, their faults and his advise when each should best be used. If I remember correctly, he had just finished a big project or migration where they had to decide on which one to use.
stories.title: Ask HN: Looking for a previously submitted article on API security protocols

stories.text:
I am used to the Uber app on my Android phone being fairly solid, the app itself is ok but lately I have having a lit of problems that seem more backend.

Example, I get dropped off at my building in the morning, but for going home I walk around the corner so it's straight onto the freeway, avoiding a couple of blocks and sets of lights. Just now going home, my pickup spot clearly showed around the corner on another street, but the driver said his pickup spot was out front of the building, about 75m away. Shit like this is every second ride now for at least a month.

I'm an Australia, but I wonder if this is a symptom of the internal state of Uber.
stories.title: Has Anyone Else Found Uber App Has Been Flakey Lately
